intro: Aphyllon epigalium subsp. notocalifornicum, commonly known as the California epigalium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a trailing or ascending perennial vine characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological role. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from other subspecies of the genus.
